parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for campaign finance reporting and are mandated for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to Brian Cristian, a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for USR Maramureș.  The image also clearly shows Brian Cristian and USR branding. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Maramureș County, based on the insights data.  This clearly addresses the wide population, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Brian Cristian in the parliamentary elections.  Phrases like "Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi," "Candidez pentru un nou mandat," and "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți" explicitly aim to influence the vote. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents some factual information (attendance record), it's primarily framed as campaign material, not objective journalism. The inclusion of personal achievements and appeals for votes outweighs any informational value.  It does not meet the standard of journalistic objectivity.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a structured campaign message designed to promote a candidate and influence voters' choices in the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>472301982091367</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Brian Cristian), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to support him in the parliamentary elections. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's content, while including some factual data, is overwhelmingly promotional in nature and lacks journalistic objectivity.  The end date of the ad (1732867200, which corresponds to November 23, 2024) is after the official end of the electoral campaign, making it a potential violation of Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Brian Cristian</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 472301982091367) cu scopul de a promova candidatura lui Brian Cristian la alegerile parlamentare,  postare ce conține un apel explicit la vot ("Votați reprezentanți care muncesc pentru voi", "Candidez pentru un nou mandat", "Vă îndemn să mă susțineți") și un număr CMF (CMF 11240015),  având un efect electoral pozitiv asupra candidatului.  Postarea, deși include unele date factuale, este preponderent de natură promoțională, lipsită de obiectivitate jurnalistică și se încadrează în definiția materialului de propagandă electorală conform art. 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  Având în vedere că postarea a fost difuzată după încheierea campaniei electorale, aceasta constituie o încălcare a prevederilor legale.  Postarea a avut o estimare a acoperirii de 50.000-100.000 de persoane, iar cheltuielile de publicitate au fost sub 100 RON, conform informațiilor din Ad Library.  Persoana de contact este maramures@usrmm.ro, +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
